website_summaries.verdict: These premium cabinet locks require no drilling and can be installed in just minutes.
pros: Designed to fit most cabinets and drawers
Offer an invisible system with a lock/unlock function
They do not leave holes in your furniture once you decide to remove the locks
Impossible to see when cabinets are shut so no eyesore impact
cons: There are situations where these products will not work well in narrow spaces

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: This works really well to keep toddlers out of the cabinets. Very Easy/quick to install. Customer service is excellent with this company as well. They keep you informed about the product before it arrives and after to ensure you are satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Mandie

customer_reviews.title: The best latches ever!
customer_reviews.text: Easiest install ever! Great quality and very adhesive tape. These will not work on all cabinets though. I did not have to use the latch catchers because of my cabinet design. This made the install even easier.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeAddict

customer_reviews.title: NO DRILLING...SUPER EASY
customer_reviews.text: These latches are perfect...just pull back the backing and stick...great as my little one is super curious so we have locked all the cabinet doors in the kitchen...I wish I had these for my first two because I had to put the other ones in with screws...these you do not. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: J. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for drawers!!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic! I wasn't sure these would work with my drawers because they don't have a completely flat surface on the inside where you attach the latch, so the latch would have to be placed lower on the drawer, too low to catch the lip of my cabinet...but included in the package is a piece of plastic that you attach on the lip of the cabinet so the latch has something to catch on!! This works perfectly!! I had ordered these before for my cabinets about a year ago and those are still working great!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Davis

customer_reviews.title: These latches are great if you want to install something like this without ...
customer_reviews.text: These latches are great if you want to install something like this without drilling and risking damage to your cabinets and drawers. It is, however, possible to pull hard enough that the adhesive comes undone-- as my toddler has demonstrated for me a few times now. Also beware-- the 8 back DOES come with an adhesive catch for each latch, which means the latches never scrape the wood of your cabinets and drawers as they close, but the 4 pack DOES NOT come with this crucial part.
customer_reviews.author: Kent S. Rancourt

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy and Quick Installation! No drilling!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe we didn’t have these for our first two kiddos! We had our third baby who is now mobile and we moved to a new home. These latches took a fraction of the time to install and they’re just as secure if not more so! I love that you have to push them down to open the cabinet. I know you do that with the other kind as well, but these don’t feel like they will wear out like the other kind. The time I saved not having to screw holes in my cabinet was amazing. I would recommend these to anyone needing latches!
customer_reviews.author: smvalek

customer_reviews.title: 100% worth the money!!
customer_reviews.text: These are super easy & convenient to install and the adhesive backing is super strong that they work like a charm! I think my daughter was blindsided that she can no longer open the kitchen cabinets :) i love this product & i will definitely purchase again when needed.
customer_reviews.author: FMS

customer_reviews.title: We had locks like this for her mother 30 years ago and they ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these cabinet lockes because of my new grand daughter. A one year old, she is miobile and curious. We had locks like this for her mother 30 years ago and they had to be screwed in. YES they never came out but what a pain to install. My husband installed 32 of these new stick on locks in an hour. SO much easier to use than the old way-- and less money as well. We will order more as needed. Would make a great gift!! This company has excellent customer service. They answered several questions for me same day. I will definitely use them again.
customer_reviews.author: Ann M.

customer_reviews.title: Adhesive didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I think I got a defective batch judging by the reviews but the adhesive on mine didn't work and I followed the directions perfectly. I'm not a stranger to these as I have them up (different brand) on lower drawers and now need them on higher drawers. The two out of the box that did stay on were able to set about 18 hours so more than the required overnight and the first time my daughter opened the drawer she got a kick out of them popping off.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Pendergras

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy and they Work
customer_reviews.text: Try all he might, baby can't get the doors open with these on. They were super easy to install though I did have to mount one of them sideways because of how my cabinets are set up.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: They just fall off
customer_reviews.text: Utterly useless. They fall off the first time the door is pulled to open. They couldn't keep my cats out of the pantry, and they don't even have thumbs. I can't imagine this would successfully keep a child with an actual grip out of anything.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: not good if your closet has a lip or counter above ...
customer_reviews.text: not good if your closet has a lip or counter above it, you cant reach in to push it down.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Really easy install! Make sure you get it right the ...
customer_reviews.text: Update: they have all pretty much fell off, nice idea but not going to hold onto any of my cabinets for anything! My son is 1 1/2 years old and has made his way into the cabinets Really easy install! Make sure you get it right the first time or it's a pain to get off. Besides that I ordered some more!
customer_reviews.author: Fadi Mustafa

customer_reviews.title: An okay product
customer_reviews.text: An okay product if you don't want to use permanent cabinet latches. Be certain to clean and dry the spot that you apply the latch to or it will not adhere properly. I found that using soap and water to clean the spot was the best way to ensure proper installation.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Hammes

customer_reviews.title: They are EASY to install and the adhesive is much stronger than ...
customer_reviews.text: These work SO WELL. They are EASY to install and the adhesive is much stronger than I anticipated. A few times, I have forgotten about them and tried to pull my cabinet door open with full force, and the latch hasn't budged.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very upset with this purchase. We really needed these because we have a severely adhd and behaviorally Autism spectrum child who we can NOT have getting into any cabinets for his own safety and not only did the adhesive not want to stick but the way they were made we couldn’t even get the cabinets to close and when we were able to we go to open the cabinet or drawer and it opens right up without and tension. They were made way too bulky and not effective enough to make children safe. I wish I could have returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: ... short to work with most cabinets and my daughter easily pulled it off the one I managed to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Too short to work with most cabinets and my daughter easily pulled it off the one I managed to get it on. You can't have a drawer or lip of a counter hanging over it or else you can't get your hand in to open it. Great idea just didn't work for our house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not built for smart kids
customer_reviews.text: My 2-year-old quickly learned if he rapidly pulled the door hard enough they would pop off
customer_reviews.author: Christina S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but my 20 month old already figured out how to open them.
customer_reviews.text: The product works fine and does what it says it will do. I love them and they are easy to use and sturdy. However, my 20 month old already figured out how to open them!!! I was hoping to get a few years out of them but sadly that won’t be the case. Just wanted to leave this experience for others that your child might be able to figure them out well before 2 years old. That may not be the case for everyone, maybe it was just a fluke with my baby or he is just an extra curious kid!?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These were such a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: These were such a waste of money. Two popped off right away and another two a few days after that. Yes, they are too good to be true. I asked for replacements for the two that popped off the first day. They said they would send them right away....I never got them. Such a scam. We ended up drilling the usual child locks on. Don’t waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible. Too short. Dont work.
customer_reviews.text: These are waaaayy too short. The 3M adhesive is nowhere near strong enough either. Super disappointed in these. You can barely fit your finger into the gap when you pull it open to press the spring down and then since you're pulling the cabinet or drawer so much to get your finger in (and for reference, my wedding ring size is in the 4's) and it starts pulling off the adhesive. It even pulled off the wood veneer on my cabinets. I ended up going with the Munchkin latches, those work way better even though they're visible, at least they actually work. My toddler can easily pull the cupboards open with these, they're useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unassuming adults will break them.
customer_reviews.text: Every time I would have someone over that would need to get into my cabinets, under my kitchen sink or the bathroom sinks, they would try to open the cabinet, fail and then the child lock would then be snapped off by the unassuming adults misinterpretation that they didn't pull hard enough the first time. There is no sign that this child lock is in use unless I tell them right before they open the cabinet. The magnet needed to then open the cabinet isn't obvious either. A good product because it is hidden well but that is also its downfall.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Simmers

customer_reviews.title: They break easily but they look really good at first.
customer_reviews.text: If someone is not expecting it to be there and pulls firmly they break. Also the glue that holds them can come off rather easily. I was very impressed when we first got them but now am disappointed. With some we had to drill a small hole so that we could put in a screw. Also they are rather expensive to be so flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: See video; our 19 month old can get by these locks in 5 seconds!
customer_reviews.text: These were very easy to install, the adhesive worked well (we cleaned the cabinets before installing), but our 19 month old figured out how to open these! Way too easy for kids to press down and open, see the video for how fast she opens them, lol They worked well for about a year since she started crawling and getting into the cabinets. I’m glad we saw her open these because it’s a liability issue with dangerous appliances and what not behind these doors!
customer_reviews.author: Foo

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Super easy to install and keeps our son from wreaking havoc in our cabinets and drawers. I really wish I could find some replacement sticker pads to install more. We ended up moving and had to remove what we initially installed and used all the extra ones included. I will say it did come off without damaging the wood. It is a bit tough to remove but I used a butter knife and pulled the lock outward and it came off easily. Not the most safe approach I know, but I didn't have a hair dryer or heat gun at the time and needed them off. Definitely worth the buy though!
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WITH 1980's CABINETRY
customer_reviews.text: ONLY USE SECONDARY RECTANGULAR PART IF you cupboard has no lip for the catch to hook onto!!!! See pix with highlighting. Also sizing pix. I'm using these for my cabinets to stop doors from flying open in Earthquakes as an added protection for crystal. STICKS * IMMEDIATELY * ! You will *not* be able to do a test stick, lift, and replace!!! So I practiced placing and using it while the sticky side was still covered to find best spot before revealing stick. No question the varnish on the back of the cabinet door will come off when ever this is removed if you have varnish there, but I don't plan on removing anytime soon so I'm fine with that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Just get these now and keep junior safe!
customer_reviews.text: My relatives frequently bring over their precocious toddler to my place, which is great. But, he's pretty mischievous and gets into things a lot... Once found him playing "driver" in the car... With the keys! Yikes! I have plenty of dangerous cleaning supplies in some cabinets, some delicate valuables in others. After installing these (super easy) I have peace of mind, his mom has peace of mind, and we can enjoy dinner parties again. Best money I ever spent, made everyone happy including junior who is not being run after or scolded as much anymore. Even if you don't have your own kid, Just buy these and enjoy your visit with them more.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cool guy

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed, only useful for certain situtations
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am not impressed by this product. They boast that it will work with any cabinet/drawer, but in reality, if there is any sort of overhang it is difficult to impossible to unlatch it. For example, I have drawers in my kitchen and the countertop overhangs by about an inch. These latches stop the drawer before it comes out enough so that you can reach the latch. I can just barely make it work if I use something long and thin to hit the latch, but who wants to do that every time?? Basically if your cabinet/drawer has no obstructions at all around the opening, this product will probably be OK. But for everything else, this is worthless
customer_reviews.author: Blin

customer_reviews.title: Nice product did not work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Did not last long for my 1yr old daughter. My cabinets did not allow for the full adhesive ti be connected to the door. Those came off fairly easy. On another cabinet the catch piece keeps getting removed. Ive replaced it twice now. I like that each adhesive piece can be reaaplied to the plastic parts. Very nice idea to not have to screw into you cabinets. Just did not work for mine and i had to secure them with screws anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H.

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install and use
customer_reviews.text: These latches were very easy to install and are easy to use on a daily basis. Our cabinet construction was such that we did not have to use the small ledge pieces, only the spring-loaded latches themselves, because our cabinets provided a natural internal ledge for the latches to grasp onto. We've only used them for a few weeks but adhesion has been strong and there are two little dimple marks where I could imagine drilling small holes and adding reinforcing screws if need be. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonDad

customer_reviews.title: Stopped my cat in its tracks
customer_reviews.text: One of our cats kept going in the lower cabinets. These stopped her in her tracks. She still tries, of course. They need an entirely flat, dry texture-free surface for the 3M adhesive patches to work well. Optimally, these should be placed closest to the opening side of the cabinet. Some cabinet doors in our house have an inconveniently placed knob screw which made this impossible. Fairly easy to pull off the catch for an adult that forgot about the latch... but work well for deterring a cat.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Isenberg

customer_reviews.title: SAFE HOME
customer_reviews.text: I HAD TO BUY THESE WHEN MY GRANDDAUGHTER TURNED 1. NOTHING WAS OFF LIMIT TO HER. SHE GOT INTO THE POTS AND PANS, THE UTILITY CABINET, AND THE HOUSEHOLD CLEANING PRODUCTS. I SPENT MOST OF THE DAY CHASING HER OUT OF CABINETS, OR CLEANING UP HER MESS. I WAS WORRIED SHE WOULD CAUSE INJURY TO HERSELF. THE LATCHES WERE EASY TO CONNECT TO THE CABINETS, AND THEY ARE STILL WORKING MONTHS LATER. SHE PULLS ON THE CABINET HANDLE BUT THEY DO NOT OPEN! GREAT PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Yashika

customer_reviews.title: They work for our one year old, but not our 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: We got these to keep our one year old out of the cabinets, the cleaning supplies cabinet in particular. It works, she can't get in there anymore, our 3 year old quickly figured them out, but she listens to us and knows to not open the cabinets. The glue part works well since many of us have yanked it a little too hard from time to time and they are still working well, haven't had the need to replace the sticky parts on them, and it has been 4 or 5 months. Definitely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Easy install- dog proof!
customer_reviews.text: Our cocker spaniel puppy's latest talent was popping open the door under our sink and rooting in the garbage can. We bought these child locks and easily installed them, reducing having to clean up messes from our "toddler" and her shredding of garbage! After installing our new safety latches, she went over to try to open the cabinets.... but alas was denied! Very pleased with this product- easy to install- no drilling, which was important as I didn't want to split the cabinet! Easy to open- my husband, myself and our two daughters (ages 10 and 6) can open these latches- but our puppy can't!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea S

customer_reviews.title: Placed on bottom of cabinets
customer_reviews.text: Rating would be 5 if the latches were longer. I have white shaker cabinets. Drawers or big kitchen sink did not allow room for finger to fit and open from the top. I installed all the latches on the bottom of the cabinets which work great. I have to touch the floor almost to open them but the hold is strong. It’s been 3 months and they haven’t come off. Also, place the latch as close to the door opening edge as possible to give as much room as you can to open.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree H

customer_reviews.title: Strong Enough to Deter Determined Cats!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to keep our cats out of our bottom kitchen cabinets. We tried it first on the cabinet under the sink to avoid ingesting any chemicals and it worked so well that we applied it to the rest of the bottom cabinets. It's super easy to install and the extra piece to place on the frame to maximize the piece on the door helped for those cabinets that were not quite even. I only wish I purchased white ones so that they were not as noticeable in our white cabinets. Alas. I'm not sure how well it'll work against a determined toddler, but it worked for exactly what we needed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Latch is too short for common cabinet style. Doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: The latch is too short, so I am not able to fit my finger in far enough into the gap to depress the spring. If you have a standard set of kitchen cabinets in which you have a larger swing door on bottom and a pull out above with a small gap between the two you won’t be able to use this product. They could simply just make them longer and it will work on all cabinet configurations.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Julien

customer_reviews.title: does the job & great quality!
customer_reviews.text: very sturdy and great quality! important to make sure you follow installation instructions. It's very easy to install but I accidentally put it one too high so had to peel off (not easy) and tried to re-position but it's made to just be installed one time. All the ones I installed right the first time work great & stick/hold powerfully. definitely better than the ones you have to screw in because it saves time and if/when you want to remove it there's no permanent damage like a screw hole would cause. Worth the extra price!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley E. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Very useful for cabinets, not so much for my drawers
customer_reviews.text: These are very bulky and tall, so they do not work in my drawers. They work very well for my cabinets though. I am worried about when it's time to remove them that they will tear part of the cabinet doors off. I'm guessing that using a heat gun or hair dryer on them before removing them will help a lot, though. For the price they've been pretty useful, but I need to figure out another solution for my drawers.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Locks don’t consistently catch
customer_reviews.text: As you can see, these locks did not work for me. I won’t say with 100% certainty that it wasn’t partly user error, but I followed directions closely and the locks seemed to work perfectly for a few weeks, but then something happened. Not sure if they loosened slightly from the cabinet/drawers or what but they no longer consistently catch. I’ve made sure to check that nothing is obstructing them from catching and that is not the case. I was trying to avoid having to drill for cabinet locks but after purchasing these and the straps that stick to the outer cabinet doors (which are also falling off), I think I’ll be dusting off the drill.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This was a perfect solution. I installed 2 packs (16 in total) ...
customer_reviews.text: We have a new house with new cabinets. The last thing I wanted to do was start drilling in the doors and face frames. This was a perfect solution. I installed 2 packs (16 in total) in my kitchen in less than 20 minutes. Update (6 months later): Safety latches are still working properly and I haven't had one come "un-stuck"
customer_reviews.author: Blake Tesnow

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install on our wooden cabinets
customer_reviews.text: I’m unable to score the “age appropriate” section as I needed these to keep out two pesky young cats. I can tell you that they were so easy to install that my husband didn’t even need to make marks on the inside of the cabinets. Somehow he just “winged it” and every single one came out fine although he did realize after the fact that it wasn’t even necessary to use the adhesive piece on most of them, only on a few.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Too short to use practically
customer_reviews.text: The included ‘stopper bar’ doesnt stick to our cupboards we’ll enough; one yank from our 10 mo. old tears it off from where it’s stuck. The ‘hook’ part sticks to the door much better, but it is very short and impossible to use on most of our cabinets- they are about 1/2 inch thick and we have an overhanging countertop. There is no way for us to squeeze our fingers in to unlock the mechanism. I almost locked ourselves out of our own cupboards when I was trying it out. I couldn’t reach in to detach it. Luckily I was able to squeeze a chopstick into the gap to depress the lever and open the cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Completely responsible for the first time I have felt joy at watching my baby sit on the floor and ...
customer_reviews.text: Completely responsible for the first time I have felt joy at watching my baby sit on the floor and cry. No more cabinet access for her!!! My organization and sanity are both saved. Easy to install, easy to use. I even tested removal (because my first lock placement was a failure that was completely my fault) and they came off no problem with a little heat from my blow dryer. Be careful with placement and they are awesome. I would suggest containing your tiny human so you can focus on install instead of using your body as a shield while you try to quickly get them attached.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Holaday

customer_reviews.title: EASIEST CHILDPROOF LOCKS
customer_reviews.text: We have two children, and with our first child we used the magnetic locks that you open with a magnet. Those are so much work to install and so much more expensive. These are sticky (BUT STICK GOOD AND STRONG) leave no residue, super easy to install and much more affordable without drilling holes in your cabinets. Does it get any easier then that? I like how easy it is to open the cabinets with these locks. Other ones at my friends house are hard to push down to get the cabinet open. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but overall a great product!
customer_reviews.text: Working great. I just wish they were a little cheaper. But you get what you pay for. We'll see how they are when it is time to remove them. We've had them on our cabinets for 3 or 4 months and they're holding on tight. They're easy to open for adults as well.
customer_reviews.author: L. E.

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT fit all cabinets
customer_reviews.text: A little tricky to install until you get the hang of it (make sure it clears everything in the drawer when you press down on the button to open). Most important, does NOT fit all cabinets. My kitchen drawers and lower cabinets meet at the top, so I was able to use on the drawers but not the cabinets; there was no way to fit my finger in at the top to unlock unless I first opened the drawer above—much too inconvenient. Otherwise, I liked the design. It would be nice if the seller had a longer version that would enable you to open the cabinet far enough to unlatch it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: These don’t work on all cabinets and drawers
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted these to work because I don’t want to have to use a magnetic key. I was pretty disappointed that these don’t work on a single cupboard or drawer in our house. Every single one doesn’t open far enough to reach the latch. If you have any sort of lip on your counter, and if your drawers or cupboard doors come up to the counter (rather than having at least a half inch of extra space between them and the bottom of the counter), don’t buy these! They won’t work!
customer_reviews.author: LWood

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Although these are easy to install and I like the idea of not putting holes in my cabinets, they just are not strong enough. Most of them pulled off within a day or two. I think they work on certain types of cabinets with a lip on the edge because the catch they come with just doesn’t hold against repeated pulls by a toddler. It was worth a try but just don’t work for my cabinets
customer_reviews.author: Queen of Princesses

customer_reviews.title: Returned all other devices and reordered 2 more boxes of these
customer_reviews.text: I bought more expensive devices for the drawers. After installing these on the cabinets with ease, and the great customer service received from the company (emails to make sure the product was quality, a note in the product indicating they would help with any install or issues with the item, etc), I put the other devices in a drawer and ordered more of these. My counter has a bit of a lip on it, so I cannot use these on the top drawers and still get my hands in to access the button, but they worked great everywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, some limitations
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to install -- just find the right position, mark it, peel the backing and stick to clean cabinet or drawer. Will not work on upper cabinets, and can be tricky with drawers that are made on a box with drawer front as a separate piece. Make sure you have something for the latch to grab on in the interior of the cabinet or drawer, or the latches won't work. Probably wouldn't work with inset drawers.
customer_reviews.author: AntKathy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Very easy to install and hold up to a toddler who has made it his mission to attempt to forcibly open every single cabinet. They also aren't a nuisance to the adult who has to circumvent them (like so many other baby products that the baby seems to figure out before the parent does). They also came very quickly. Happy with my purchase and will end up purchasing more.
customer_reviews.author: miasampietro

customer_reviews.title: They don't stick to wood cabinets.
customer_reviews.text: Cleaned the surface, they would not stick enough for the child to pull open very easily, 14 months old. They just fell off with very little force applied. You certainly wouldn't trust your child's well being to this device. I am an engineer and I could measure the force required to open the cabinet, not worth the climb. I am returning them. I can't see a way to make them better without screws.
customer_reviews.author: RVI

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy to use, but need to attach in exact spot
customer_reviews.text: These cabinet latches are really wonderful and easy for adults to use. They keep my baby from opening cabinets, but she is still young, so I can’t guarantee yet that they would work for an older toddler. They are easy to stick on and stay firm once they’re attached. I did take off one star because you need to attach them in the exact spot needed, not too high and not too low, and it could be hard to get it exactly. If you by mistake attach it in the wrong space, I don’t think there’s a way to detach and reattach. However, it should still work there, just it won’t work as well.
customer_reviews.author: Menachem Lapidus

customer_reviews.title: Works for now
customer_reviews.text: Just installed them, I have cats & a toddler trying to get into the cabinets.. Within minutes of installing my daughter realized she can drop stuff down the crack at the top when she pulls it open... so fetching her toys out all day isn’t ideal.. and hearing the cabinet door partly open and shut when the cats try to get in also isn’t ideal.. I’ll be on the lookout for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install, Child Proof
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to install on any cabinet or drawer without any tools necessary (you just have to apply some force to get them to initially stick and then allow the adhesive to dry a bit before working it too hard). Once they are in place and stuck, they work very well. My almost 3 year old daughter cannot get any breakables out of our kitchen cabinets or get into anything unsafe from our bathroom cabinets! What more could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Dragna

customer_reviews.title: Seems practical, but...
customer_reviews.text: This product was easy to install and looked very promising. I was excited and relieved that My drawers r baby safe. But, my 15 month old was able to open it with his force. The adhesive just came off. Update: I initially thought that some defective ones were hit and a miss. But now all installed ones are coming off. A little extra force from my toddler is all that is needed for the adhesive to come off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat proof! AND great for apartments!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these! Out of all the safety latches and locks I looked at this seemed the easiest, so I was hoping they would hold up. I've had these so far for almost 4 months and they're great. Our cat was trying to open the bathroom cabinets and they would bang, so these have helped a lot. I also love that it's just a sticker - because we rent an apartment these will be easy to take off and won't ruin the cabinets. Definitely recommend for pet owners!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect locks for safety with no damage
customer_reviews.text: We love these locks! We were looking for something that wouldn't destroy our cabinets and these are perfect. They take about 2 minutes to install, are invisible from the outside,and stick great. We accidentally pull on the cabinets all the time (bc we forget they're there) and they've yet to come off. They are easy for an adult to open and our 1 year old has no clue. She yanks a couple times and gives up. These are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: If you have frameless cabinets, get the extra long version of these latches. Other than that, these latches are great. The adhesive is quite strong - stronger than my toddler, and when I needed to remove them, it was easy to get rid of the residue. These latches are very easy to install, and if you have any issues, the company is very responsive. I recommend these wholeheartedly because they are strong, installation is straightforward, and it doesn't require permanently altering your cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Galinsky

customer_reviews.title: Too short!!
customer_reviews.text: Junk! They’re too short to fit any drawers or doors because we shockingly have countertops above ours. They’re going back. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, but short to unlock easily
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this product. I needed a product that child proofed our cabinets but stayed hidden. Unfortunately, if the space from the cabinet to the lip the latch is supposed to grasp on to, then good luck easily opening the lock. I couldn’t fit my finger in the little opening when the latch was locked to open my cabinets. Good concept but bad execution.
customer_reviews.author: FMR

customer_reviews.title: Drill is needed!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I only gave it four stars since the adhesion is not really reliable. I would recommend drilling these into your cabinets. If your toddler is anything like mine, adhesive locks are not an option. My kid likes to walk around the house and yank on cabinets 1000 times in a row. I didn’t really feel comfortable with just using adhesive. Otherwise, these child safety locks are great!
customer_reviews.author: Eva MacInnis

customer_reviews.title: Tough boy approved!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in the beginning of the summer. I installed them for my 10 month old. He was literally getting into every cabinet in our apartment. I used these and the zip ones. My wife, constantly forgets to lock those and these good stuff ones hold up. My son can't open the doors and he's quite the strong one. No matter how hard he pulls they don't open. They are also easy to install and their customer service follow up is nobibhn less than phenomenal. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Shadz Y.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for the first few months
customer_reviews.text: I ended up having to add screws to many of them as they were starting to fall off. 2 small screws and they were as good as new. I am sure this is going to be the case with any of these that only have double-sided tape no matter how good the tape is. I pre-drilled holes in the plastic and used small spare screws I had on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: Works well, a little challenging to install
customer_reviews.text: I like that they are not drilled into the cupboards as we are renting. I had to remove one already to readjust it and it did not destroy the cabinet. It is a little hard to install if there isn't a lip on the cabinet, which is the case for our pantry. It comes with another piece for that situation but unfortunately the pantry is cheap and the adhesive wouldn't stick to the wood. Probably would work better on higher quality cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable Price and Fine Performance
customer_reviews.text: The product installs easily and works well. Special kudos to Amazon on this one. Our first order was misdelivered by our totally random USPS person and did not show up until a guy far down the street from us discovered it in his mailbox. By then Amazon had refunded our charge and we ordered again. Then Amazon made it easy to return the second order.
customer_reviews.author: GVGeorge

customer_reviews.title: GET THESE!
customer_reviews.text: Real easy both to install and use. Anything plastic and this light, though, could always break; hence only a 4 out of 5 stars for durability, but these are also cheap and easy enough to install that replacing a broken one here and there—if they even EVER break—makes buying these well worth any risk there might be. Heck, it’s either these or some heavy or hard to install, more expensive set of sorts! Golly, GET THESE!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well, 1 month under heavy usage stands still!
customer_reviews.text: Unlike others safety latches, it is hidden behind the cabinet door and keep my kitchen aesthetic. Though, my initial installation attempt was not successful, the latch arm is too short and make it impossible for me to unlock. I contacted the customer service, and Kayla was very helpful and I was provided a free replacement with the other version with longer arm ( It works as charm. So make sure you choose the right one for your cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: heisthedon

customer_reviews.title: Check cabinets before ordering
customer_reviews.text: These didn't work for us due to cabinet dimensions. Buried a few photos in to the product image library is an image that shows the overhang on your cabinets or countertops can't be more than 1/4 inch for these to work. Be sure to check the product images and your cabinetry before ordering. Adding back 1 star because the adhesive was great, and I was able to easily remove with a hair dryer after realizing they wouldn't work for us.
customer_reviews.author: Emma R

customer_reviews.title: Product doesn’t last long...poor material
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to keep my young children out of my cabinets. I liked the thought of not having to drill holes in cabinets or having large bulky locks on the outside of handles. I received my order in a timely manner. I was under the impression that “12 pieces” meant 12 locks...super excited about that! I was very disappointed when I opened the box to find only 10 and even more disappointed when 2 broke while installing. So now, I have 5 locks which have lasted about a month and a half. 3 locks have broke off or the adhesion has dried up. Overall I’m not impressed and wouldn’t recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: Way too simple to install! Almost felt like it was magic.
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to mount it just a little lower than you'd expect. At least, when I eyeballed it, I was a bit too high and had to remount it. When I got the knack, they went on first time every time. Adhesion is so good that it still sticks well on the one I had to pull off and put on three times to get the feel for how to mount it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Card

customer_reviews.title: UPDATED: does not work on ALL cabinets
customer_reviews.text: depends on the depth of the closet lip, where the latch latches onto. it did not work on our drawers and cabinets. UPDATE: I randomly received a package from the GoodStuff, a box of new latches where the depth is adjustable! brilliant! along with a letter, explaining they were sorry to hear their original latches didn't work with my cabinets. so they sent me the adjustable latches free of charge. appreciate the excellent customer service! eunice
customer_reviews.author: Eunice Rhee

customer_reviews.title: Great, but not the best
customer_reviews.text: We decided to go with these safety latches instead of others because of the easy installation process, but I almost with I would have gone with others simply because of them not sticking super well all the time and if you pull the cabinet hard enough, one of the two fall off. Not the best, but they do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Hales

customer_reviews.title: Great Safety Latches!
customer_reviews.text: These are great so far, only had them on the cabinets for a week or so. My eight month old has already been standing up and tugging on the cabinets so they stood up to his test. My only complaint is that I wish they allowed the cabinets to open a tiny bit further. I have small hands and it’s slightly difficult for me to get my finger in to push the latch. Other than that I love them. It took two seconds to install them and customer service was great when i has a question.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Clean

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install but not for all types of cabinet’s  doors
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to try this product since I have to keep my toddler out of my wife’s makeup. After carefully following the instructions I realized that the product has an issue, it doesn’t work for doors that are flush and don’t have space above to introduce your finger. Therefore, there is not enough space for an adult to introduce the finger to open the door. That can be solved by doing a longer hook to allow the door to open a little more. I wasted my money since all the cabinet doors I wanted to protect are flush in my house
customer_reviews.author: Yumbert

customer_reviews.title: Best Latches Out There
customer_reviews.text: These latches are fantastic, super quick and easy to install and use! If you have newer cabinets where the doors are a little bigger than the actual opening behind them like ours do, you don't even have to use the 2nd piece, the overhang on the opening is enough to catch the latch. They have held up great so far for the last few months to our son constantly trying to open the cupboards. I love that I didn't have to put any permanent markings on our cabinets and you can't tell that there's anything on them when there closed. The black latch blends nicely into our espresso cabinets so even when they're open you don't notice them.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda B.

customer_reviews.title: BEST best Best!
customer_reviews.text: The latch sticks on easily, holds great and actually worked in a less-than-perfect spot (in our under-the kitchen-sink cabinet, where the sink basin protrudes a bit...) Perfect. We've used scrunchies, elastics, hook and eye latches....all to no avail to keep my dog out of our trash. This latch WORKS, and looks the best out of all of out solutions!
customer_reviews.author: Juergen M.

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT fit all cabinets
customer_reviews.text: We tried to install these on our kitchen cabinets, entertainment center and book case and it didn't work with any of them. The design is flawed. Also, the adhesives will come off with one good pull.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Healy

customer_reviews.title: Don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste of money. Like I show in the video if you gently pull on it you can see "it works" give it a harder pull and it opens completely. My toddler still able to open the drawers no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Shanahan

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work but great customer service
customer_reviews.text: We got the latches but unfortunately they dont work with our cabinets. When we open the cabinet door, it doesn't come out far enough for us to push the latch down to unlock it because the drawers above the cabinet come out too far. I contacted the seller and they not only issued a full refund without having me send them back but also sending me a set of adjustable latches free of charge to see if those work better. Very impressed with their customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No. Find another brand.
customer_reviews.text: You know how adults and children alike tend to pull really hard to open something if they think it's just stuck? Well that will happen when you install these and then the adhesive will come right off or the locking tab will break. These are not meant to withstand a lot of force. Please find another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt Work
customer_reviews.text: adhesion not strong enough. wont childproof your drawers. i tried several drawer types around my house and everytime when i opened the drawer it popped right off. so i left it adhere for about half and hr and really pushed it on... my toddler then opens it and it opens fully because the hook just pops right off bc the adhesion isnt strong enough. i remember these working with my younger siblings on the same drawers, guess these arent as strong or are poor quality compared to the ones we used 10 years ago from walmart probably.
customer_reviews.author: timothy j eugster

customer_reviews.title: They don't stick very well
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased another set that came with 8 plus some other stuff that I didn't need and those are absolutely great. But I needed more to add to the bathroom cabinets and drawers and decided to go with these. Half of them have come off and they don't get as much use as the kitchen ones. I'd spend a little more on a better set.
customer_reviews.author: Ines

customer_reviews.title: Well above average - minor downsides
customer_reviews.text: The 3M adhesive isn't top notch, but sufficient enough for us. We cleaned surfaces, only attached to smooth non-pourous material that was matte/unfinished and several latches still detached. Super glue did the trick and they work great now. CAUTION! The lever arms are rather short, so be sure to gauge your cabinet box design. One or two areas in our home can't use these latches because the arm doesn't extrude far enough to depress it and release the catch. All in all it is a good product and worth the money in our opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy and WORKS!! 100%
customer_reviews.text: I have had these on my cabinets for two years now and they are as sturdy as when I first put them on! They are so easy to install and do not need perfect measuring to get them on! Only takes seconds to place them! I use them for my dogs and my child, none of them have been able to get around the latch!
customer_reviews.author: Rsher

customer_reviews.title: Ninja locks
customer_reviews.text: First, I ordered a set of locks from a different company that required a magnet “key” to open. Long story short, they wouldn’t fit our cabinets and the plastic was weak. So, I ordered this product and had five locks installed in 10 minutes. It was really that easy. My one year old is now pissed that he can’t open our kitchen drawers although he continues to try and force them open. Needless to say, the locks are durable and strong. I would highly recommend this product even though my child would not. He is not ready to respect a worthy adversary, but one day, he will conquer these locks. Unfortunately, that day won’t be any day soon.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M.

customer_reviews.title: These are so quick and easy. Had these for almost a year and they ...
customer_reviews.text: These are so quick and easy. Had these for almost a year and they hold up well. Easy to remove with a hair dryer. Saves having to drill into very hard cabinets. Great product tested by my 1.5 year old with zero failures!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M.

customer_reviews.title: Durable & Effective
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install and the 3M adhesive is extremely durable. Despite his daily efforts, my son has yet to destroy the locks. This is my second set of these latches, pulled out old cabinets and ruined the original ones. Thew new batch of latches seems to be shorter or the latch plate is wider than the previous. There is room for your fingers between the door and cabinet face when installing the latch plate flush with the front of the cabinet. Yes, this is annoying and might be peculiar to my cabinets, but the product itself is super functional.
customer_reviews.author: Troy P.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money- adhesive fails
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought these worked well for cabinets and not so well for drawers. I was okay with that, and I was content to find another product to use for childproofing my drawers. However, I have only had these installed for less than a month and the adhesive has already failed now for my cabinets. These are really easy to install and require no tools, but this doesn’t matter if the product doesn’t work. I am beyond disappointed that I have wasted money on this. Since I have already installed them, I can’t return them. Do not waste your money on these!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Plastic that is STRONG enough to keep Toddler SAFE
customer_reviews.text: Safety 1st! These locks are cheap, easy to stick on, and strong enough to keep a toddler from getting into the cabinets. I def recommend these locks especially for those who move a lot and do not want to damage the counter tops. Comes with more adhesive so if you can get more use out of them. Great customer service
customer_reviews.author: Amanda B.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Adhesion: MY CAT BROKE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, yes. Durable? NO! Of the 12 installed (properly, set for 24 hours), my cat opened three base cabinet doors - the adhesion was simply not strong enough. If a 10lb cat can open a door with these locks installed, I'm guessing a child could just as easily.
customer_reviews.author: DepotsNutz

customer_reviews.title: Great fit securing cabinets for vearthquakes!
customer_reviews.text: I don't have babies, but I bought this to prevent my cabinets from opening during earthquakes. And it is great! If you get it just right, you can just cost the cabinets and it'll automatically latch itself securely. Super easy to install, once you get used to it, it takes only a few minutes!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: These latches are great! They are so easy to put in place and I’ve had no issues with them sticking like some reviews I’ve read. It’s important you clean the area before you stick the latch to the door. What I love about these is it’s not permanent, they are so easy to install and they keep my very curious 1 yr old grandson out of the cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: Correne

customer_reviews.title: Great locks
customer_reviews.text: These locks work perfect for my kitchen. My one year old is very curious so we needed to safety proof our entire house but more importantly, our kitchen. I installed them easily with my 3 year helping out. My 3 year old has since figured out how to open the cabinets but he wasn’t the one I was worried about in the cabinets. I’ll be recommending these and will be purchasing some more for the bathrooms.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi0802

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you need!
customer_reviews.text: We tried ones that screw into the cabinet door first and these are so much easier to install and work just as well if not better. Our 20 month old tests them daily and they haven't faultered yet! We would definitely buy these again if we were to move or need to add them to more cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: These work great and the adhesive is strong.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for cabinets. Drawers, I had trouble because I have a lip that caused me to not be able to stick the whole adhesive part on, but that really isn't an issue with the product. The cabinets I have these on work great. They have been on there for a couple months now and show no signs of losing its stick. Much easier to install than the kind you have to screw into the cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: CJ S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. Clean surface, peel backing, stick and hold. Done! There is are pieces included if your drawer doesn’t have something for the Maine piece to latch to. We’ve had them up for a week now. They works wonderfully for the baby. My husband still forgets they’re there so pulls quickly at the drawers and they have withstood that!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crappy product!
customer_reviews.text: This product is absolutely garbage. At first it worked, but doesn't stick very well after a week plus. My 1 year son has managed to pull them off. Flushed good money down the toilet on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Pedram Alizadeh

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Got these locks to keep my 1 yr old out of kitchen cabinets. Followed ither reviewer's recommendations and wiped the surfaces clean with alcohol wipes first. So far they're sticking strongly! 4 stars only because these are a bit on the short side though; the opening allows for maybe a 1 inch gap to get your finger in to depress the unlock spring. I've used longer locks in the past that were easier to get ti but really like the spring mechanism on these so it's a tradeoff.
customer_reviews.author: V Ang

product_meta.title: Cabinet Locks Child Safety Latches - Quick and Easy Adhesive Baby Proofing Cabinets Lock and Drawers Latch - Child Safety with No Magnetic Keys to Lose, and No Tools, Drilling or Measuring Required
feature_bullets: KEEP LITTLE FINGERS SAFE FROM HARM - These child safety cabinet latches keep toddlers out of medicine cabinets, cleaning closets, and knife drawers. Protect your family and keep them safe!
SIMPLE CHILD SAFETY CABINET LOCKS - Just Peel and Stick for Child Proofed Cabinets and Drawers without Drililng Holes in your Furniture
NO MAGNET KEYS TO LOSE - Unlike magnetic cabinet locks, these child safety latches have no keys to misplace!
SIMPLE TO USE CABINET LOCKS FOR CHILD SAFETY - Just peel off the sticker, attach to your cabinet or drawer, then leave overnight to set! No tools needed!
CHILD SAFETY CABINET LOCKS FOR MOST CABINETS - While these baby proof cabinet latches work for most kitchen cabinets, overhanging work surfaces or cabinet surrounds can prevent access.

DISCRETE AND NON INVASIVE DESIGN – Completely invisible when your cabinets are shut, but strong and secure enough to keep your children out of harm, you can child safe your kitchen with child locks that can’t be seen when the doors are shut.

EXTRA SECURE AND DURABLE – Unlike cheap imitations, we use only the strongest 3M adhesive, highest quality materials, and extra strength springs in our child safety locks, you can be sure that these latches are keeping your kids safe all day long.

PERFECT BABY SHOWER GIFT - These baby locks make for a great baby shower birth announcement or new baby present New parents will be prepared when their infant begins crawling at 6 months old the suggested time to baby proof

specifications.Safety warning: Keep knife drawers, medicine cabinets, and cleaning closets secured from little fingers!
specifications.Material free: Latches for cabinets, Drawer latches for toddlers, 3M Adhesive Cabinet Locks, Baby safety cabinet locks, Child proof locks
specifications.Care instructions: These childproof cabinet locks attach easily, Simply stick them to your cabinet doors!, And the cabinet locks remove without residue, To remove these cabinet latches, Point a hairdryer at the base
specifications.Additional product features: The Good Stuff, Secure cabinets and drawers from toddlers
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,593 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
